intro: Draba aizoides proles zahlbruckneri, commonly known as the Zahrbruckner's whitlow grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its low-growing habit and small, basal leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers during the spring season. It is typically found in alpine and subalpine regions, growing in rocky or gravelly soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
